Class FileObject

java.lang.Object
inout.FileObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class FileObject extends Object implements Serializable

The FileObject class implements a stream file and connect it to an object stream to read or write objects from or for file.
The FileObject class has the following methods:
(1) turnOnReader() - open file in read mode;
(2) objectReader() - read an object in an open file in read mode;
(3) turnOffReader() - close file in read mode;
(4) turnOnWriter() - open file in read mode;
(5) objectWriter() - write an object in an open file in write mode;
(6) turnOffWriter() - close file in write mode.
Version:
22.04.a
Author:
Gilberto Rouxinol

  • Method Details

    • turnOnReader

      public boolean turnOnReader(String fileName)
      Open file in read mode
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file to read an object
      Returns:
      true the file exists and the stream is ok or false the file doesn't exist or the stream has problems
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If a file not found exception occurred.
      IOException - If an input output exception occurred.

    • objectReader

      public Object objectReader()
      Read an object in an open file in read mode
      Returns:
      Object the object itself or null if an exception is launched
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException - If a class not found exception occurred.
      IOException - If an input output exception occurred.

    • turnOffReader

      public boolean turnOffReader()
      Close file in read mode
      Returns:
      true file closed with success or false file not closed
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input outpu exception occurred.

    • turnOnWriter

      public boolean turnOnWriter(String fileName)
      Open file in write mode
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file to write an object
      Returns:
      true the file exists and the stream is ok or false the file doesn't exist or the stream has problems
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If a file not found exception occurred.
      IOException - If an input output exception occurred.

    • objectWriter

      public boolean objectWriter(Object objectName)
      Write an object in an open file in write mode
      Parameters:
      objectName - the name of the object
      Returns:
      true the object was successfully written or false the object wasn't successfully written
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input output exception occurred.

    • turnOffWriter

      public boolean turnOffWriter()
      Close file in write mode
      Returns:
      true file closed with success or false file not closed
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input output exception occurred.
